slidelink.displaytext: Solving Public Problems With Data - Session 8
Strengthening a Data Analytic Culture (Total Session Length: 53:33)
Pillar 1 - Understand Your Organization's Needs and the Ability to Meet Them (5:18)
Pillar 4 - Distinguish Analytics from Data Management (3:48)
Pillar 5 - Show Return on Investment Early with Complete Successes (7:47)
Pillar 6 - Create a Low Barrier of Entry (5:36)
Pillar 7 - Provide Repeatable and Flexible Training (3:35)
Pillar 9 - Grow Towards Making Yourself Smaller (3:21)
Pillar 10 - Clarify & Solidify the Role of Analytics (3:37)

search.slidetext: strengthening the analytics culture of your organization amen-ra mashariki funded by a grant from the www.thegovlab.org

chief analytics officer, city of new york director, mayor’s office of data analytics (moda) previous experience: motorola johns hopkins applied physics laboratory white house fellow white house office of personnel management amen-ra mashariki

10 pillars of strengthening the analytics culture of your organization session outline understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand the characteristics of your organization obtain executive buy-in distinguish analytics from data management show return on investment early with complete successes create low barrier of entry provide repeatable & flexible training create reusable analytics frameworks grow towards making yourself smaller clarify & solidify the role of analytics in your organization

10 pillars of strengthening the analytics culture of your organization pillar 1 – understand your organization’s needs and the ability to meet them understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand the characteristics of your organization obtain executive buy-in distinguish analytics from data management show return on investment early with complete successes create low barrier of entry provide repeatable & flexible training create reusable analytics frameworks grow towards making yourself smaller clarify & solidify the role of analytics in your organization understand: the clear problem in relation to the analytics capability and technology spectrum the innovation strategy—how they think they are solving problems the core goals, the mission and the performance metrics and kpi (key performance indicators) the organization’s definition of roi (return on investment)

10 pillars of strengthening the analytics culture of your organization pillar 2 – understand your organization’s characteristics understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand the characteristics of your organization obtain executive buy-in distinguish analytics from data management show return on investment early with complete successes create low barrier of entry provide repeatable & flexible training create reusable analytics frameworks grow towards making yourself smaller clarify & solidify the role of analytics in your organization understand: the attitudes and behavioral characteristics the goals, mission and performance metrics what enables or impedes the progress of initiatives the processes of how things get done the size of the organization and how fast they adopt technology

10 pillars of strengthening the analytics culture of your organization pillar 3 – obtain executive buy-in ? understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand the characteristics of your organization obtain executive buy-in distinguish analytics from data management show return on investment early with complete successes create low barrier of entry provide repeatable & flexible training create reusable analytics frameworks grow towards making yourself smaller clarify & solidify the role of analytics in your organization understand: from whom do you need the buy-in the strategic point of entry to start building supporters (top-down, bottom-up, or both)

10 pillars of strengthening the analytics culture of your organization pillar 4 – distinguish analytics from data management understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand the characteristics of your organization obtain executive buy-in distinguish analytics from data management show return on investment early with complete successes create low barrier of entry provide repeatable & flexible training create reusable analytics frameworks grow towards making yourself smaller clarify & solidify the role of analytics in your organization understand the difference to make adoption easier: data stewardship data governance first step: data management data security data providence data quality describing data surfacing data second step: data analytics mapping data machine learning improve inform

10 pillars of strengthening the analytics culture of your organization pillar 5 – show return on investment early with complete successes understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand the characteristics of your organization obtain executive buy-in distinguish analytics from data management show return on investment early with complete successes create low barrier of entry provide repeatable & flexible training create reusable analytics frameworks grow towards making yourself smaller clarify & solidify the role of analytics in your organization understand: quick wins vs. “complete” successes (end-to-end process that entails): start with understanding the organization end with the organization being more situationally aware, smarter and informed than how they began all of the different ways you want/need to be impactful the difference between the short, mid, and long term solutions (the answer to a question will certainly produce new and smarter questions, so build a mechanism that allows for continuous engagement through time) quick tips to achieve complete data analytics successes: become the data therapist of the organization and find out: what’s their relationship with data? how do they use data? what does data mean to them? what do they mean to the data? how long have they been using the data? how long have they been happy or unhappy with the data? go through iterative and agile processes in terms of understanding the challenges make the process open and transparent

10 pillars of strengthening the analytics culture of your organization pillar 6 – create a low barrier of entry understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand the characteristics of your organization obtain executive buy-in distinguish analytics from data management show return on investment early with complete successes create low barrier of entry provide repeatable & flexible training create reusable analytics frameworks grow towards making yourself smaller clarify & solidify the role of analytics in your organization understand: what tools different parts of your organization use for data analysis (e.g., excel) when you can utilize tools already in use to create new solutions? how to improve the communication channels between analysis and other teams

10 pillars of strengthening the analytics culture of your organization pillar 7 – provide repeatable & flexible training understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand the characteristics of your organization obtain executive buy-in distinguish analytics from data management show return on investment early with complete successes create low barrier of entry provide repeatable & flexible training create reusable analytics frameworks grow towards making yourself smaller clarify & solidify the role of analytics in your organization build a training curriculum that is: flexible – easy to adapt as the organization changes: the way people learn the things people need to know the views people have on the problems the organization is facing reusable – the knowledge stays in the organization easy for the trainee to become the trainer

10 pillars of strengthening the analytics culture of your organization pillar 8 – create reusable analytics frameworks understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand the characteristics of your organization obtain executive buy-in distinguish analytics from data management show return on investment early with complete successes create low barrier of entry provide repeatable & flexible training create reusable analytics frameworks grow towards making yourself smaller clarify & solidify the role of analytics in your organization identify: similarities in the questions solutions with similar characteristics the framework that can be drawn from those solutions

10 pillars of strengthening the analytics culture of your organization pillar 9 – grow towards making yourself smaller understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand the characteristics of your organization obtain executive buy-in distinguish analytics from data management show return on investment early with complete successes create low barrier of entry provide repeatable & flexible training create reusable analytics frameworks grow towards making yourself smaller clarify & solidify the role of analytics in your organization how-to: create a centralized analytics team that can drive a lot of the initiatives empower others – not yourself team should have an (x) to (x + n) year horizon

10 pillars of strengthening the analytics culture of your organization pillar 10 – clarify & solidify the role of analytics understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand your organization’s needs, and the ability to meet those needs understand the characteristics of your organization obtain executive buy-in distinguish analytics from data management show return on investment early with complete successes create low barrier of entry provide repeatable & flexible training create reusable analytics frameworks grow towards making yourself smaller clarify & solidify the role of analytics in your organization know-how: understand what makes a mature analytics capacity in your organization do not change the “core” analytics capacity even though there’s change in: leadership budget needs
